        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>UAF in the content::RenderWidgetHostImpl::RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary in the browser process(escape the sandbox)<span class="line"><!---->UAF in the content::RenderWidgetHostImpl::RejectMouseLockOrUnlockIfNecessary in the browser process(escape the sandbox)<!----></span><br><br>The portal element + url jump in the pdf plugin + requestPointerLock will cause the UAF.<span class="line"><!---->The portal element + url jump in the pdf plugin + requestPointerLock will cause the UAF.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: The latest chromium, asan-win32-release_x64-836542<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: The latest chromium, asan-win32-release_x64-836542<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>chrome://flags/#enable-portals<span class="line"><!---->chrome://flags/#enable-portals<!----></span><br><br>C:\chromium_version\asan-win32-release_x64-836542>chrome.exe  --enable-features=Portals,PortalsCrossOrigin --user-data-dir=c:/tmp/ppp <span class="line"><!---->C:\chromium_version\asan-win32-release_x64-836542&gt;chrome.exe  --enable-features=Portals,PortalsCrossOrigin --user-data-dir=c:/tmp/ppp <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1/poc/portal.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1/poc/portal.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1/poc/portal.html<!----></a><br><br>1. open the portal.html   >>  acitvate and open the url.pdf <span class="line"><!---->1. open the portal.html   &gt;&gt;  acitvate and open the url.pdf <!----></span><br>2. click anywhere in the pdf document  >> jump to the pointerlock.html<span class="line"><!---->2. click anywhere in the pdf document  &gt;&gt; jump to the pointerlock.html<!----></span><br>3. click "ClickMe" button in the pointerlock.html<span class="line"><!---->3. click "ClickMe" button in the pointerlock.html<!----></span><br>4. close the tab or click the back navigation in the upper right corner will both triger the UAF stably.<span class="line"><!---->4. close the tab or click the back navigation in the upper right corner will both triger the UAF stably.<!----></span><br><br>See the gif <span class="line"><!---->See the gif <!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [browser]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [browser]<!----></span><br><br>C:\chromium_version\asan-win32-release_x64-836542>chrome.exe  --enable-features=Portals,PortalsCrossOrigin --user-data-dir=c:/tmp/pp<span class="line"><!---->C:\chromium_version\asan-win32-release_x64-836542&gt;chrome.exe         The <span class="line"><!---->The <!----></span>Issue 1158381<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1158381" title="Security: Bypass iframe security policy in the portal element"><!---->Issue 1158381<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>don't allow MimeHandlerViews to navigate away from their handling extension.<span class="line"><!---->don't allow MimeHandlerViews to navigate away from their handling extension.<!----></span><br>Maybe the <span class="line"><!---->Maybe the <!----></span>issue 1158381<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1158381" title="Security: Bypass iframe security policy in the portal element"><!---->issue 1158381<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>submitted code also fixed this issue.<span class="line"><!---->submitted code also fixed this issue.<!----></span><br>This issue also exploits the pdf navigate to cause the UAF in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->This issue also exploits the pdf navigate to cause the UAF in the browser process.<!----></span><br>Will these two issues count as the same vulnerability?<span class="line"><!---->Will these two issues count as the same vulnerability?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Just to also update this bug (I've mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->Just to also update this bug (I've mentioned in <!----></span>issue 1158381<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1158381" title="Security: Bypass iframe security policy in the portal element"><!---->issue 1158381<!----></a>): Kevin's CL already fixed the issue, but the CL I just landed should prevent a UaF from pointer lock in case there's another bug that allows loading content inside a MimeHandlerView.<span class="line"><!---->): Kevin's CL already fixed the issue, but the CL I just landed should prevent a UaF from pointer lock in case there's another bug that allows loading content inside a MimeHandlerView.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. byte legend (one shadow byte represents 8 application bytes):<span class="line"><!---->Shadow byte legend (one shadow byte represents 8 application bytes):<!----></span><br>  Addressable: fe<span class="line"><!---->  ASan internal:           fe<!----></span><br>  Left alloca redzone:     ca<span class="line"><!---->  Left alloca redzone:     ca<!----></span><br>  Right alloca redzone:         Just to also update this bug (I've mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->Just to also update this bug (I've mentioned in <!----></span>issue 1158381<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1158381" title="Security: Bypass iframe security policy in the portal element"><!---->issue 1158381<!----></a>): Kevin's CL already fixed the issue, but the CL I just landed should prevent a UaF from pointer lock in case there's another bug that allows loading content inside a MimeHandlerView.<span class="line"><!---->): Kevin's CL already fixed the issue, but the CL I just landed should prevent a UaF from pointer lock in case there's another bug that allows loading content inside a MimeHandlerView.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The flaky test seems to be happening because WaitForLoadStop is failing (from <span class="line"><!---->The flaky test seems to be happening because WaitForLoadStop is failing (from <!----></span>https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-bfcache-rel/13747/overview<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-bfcache-rel/13747/overview"><!---->https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-bfcache-rel/13747/overview<!----></a>):<span class="line"><!---->):<!----></span><br><br>../../extensions/browser/guest_view/mime_handler_view/mime_handler_view_browsertest.cc:584: Failure<span class="line"><!---->../../extensions/browser/guest_view/mime_handler_view/mime_handler_view_browsertest.cc:584: Failure<!----></span><br>Value of: WaitForLoadStop(guest_contents)<span class="line"><!---->Value of: WaitForLoadStop(guest_contents)<!----></span><br>  Actual: false<span class="line"><!---->  Actual: false<!----></span><br>Expected: true<span class="line"><!---->Expected: true<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */

          position: relative;
        }

        for LitElement.

window.prpcClient = new AutoRefreshPrpcClient(
 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
